thread.title: 'Davina McCall has SAVED The Nightly Show' Presenter praised for turn at hosting ITV show
thread.title_full: 'Davina McCall has SAVED The Nightly Show' Presenter praised for turn at hosting ITV show

author: Jennifer Crothers
title: 'Davina McCall has SAVED The Nightly Show' Presenter praised for turn at hosting ITV show
text:
'Davina McCall has SAVED The Nightly Show' Presenter praised for turn at hosting ITV show David Walliams and John Bishop had previously failed to impress on the talk show Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Davina is praised for saving 'The Nighly Show' on ITV Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Nightly Show has been continually blasted by viewers since it started on ITV two weeks ago. 
The talk show's format involves a celebrity taking over as host every weeknight for a whole week. 
David Walliams hosted the first week to a very poor reception, and then John Bishop didn't do a much better job the week after. 
However, queen of TV Davina McCall took the reins in tonight's show, and viewers absolutely LOVED her, with some claiming she's "saved The Nightly Show". 
One said: "At last a presenter who knows how it's done @ThisisDavina #onlytooktwoweeks #thenightlyshow." 
Another agreed: "Has @ThisisDavina actually won #thenightlyshow ? Like a different show." 
A third rejoiced: "@thisisdavina has saved #thenightlyshow." 
Davina was chatting to Boy George and The Replacement actress Vicky McClure on the episode. 
And she even got the actress to rap Missy Elliot after performing a rap herself. 
Some viewers were even complaining the show was now too SHORT, with one saying: "@ThisisDavina finally going to start watching #thenightlyshow loving this but need a bit longer for the chat 30 mins not enough for it all." 
Before Davina's successful turn on the show, even the stars of Gogglebox blasted The Nightly Show - after having to watch it for our entertainment. David Walliams looks pretty happy with his alleged Â£50,000 an episode paycheque (Photo: Rex Features) Stephen and Chris were overcome with boredom (Photo: Channel 4) The Woerdenweber family weren't impressed (Photo: Channel 4) 
And the Gogglebox lot echoed the feelings of a nation as they watched the show and were either bored, frustrated by David's line of questioning or completely lost concentration. 
Brighton pals Chris and Stephen were nonplussed, with Stephen confessing, "Oh god I feel like my eyes are rolling into the back of my head I'm so bored." 
The Woerdenweber family weren't impressed either, with mum Viv branding host David's questions 'not very thrilling' before husband Ralf rubbed his eyes in boredom and sighed, "Oh my god." Sisters Ellie and Izzi didn't care for the show (Photo: Channel 4) David Walliams and his first guest, popular TV actor Martin Clunes (Photo: Rex Features) Read More 'Truly awful' ITV Nightly Show is huge flop with viewers as host David Walliams is slammed for 'gut wrenching' presenting 
But it was sisters Izzi and Ellie who hit the nail on the head, pointing out that it was the kind of show that you might just have on in the background while doing something else. Like going to sleep. 
"See, I'm quite switched off now," admitted Ellie, honestly. "I feel like this would be the point I'd have it on in bed and pick up my phone and look on Facebook." Like us on Facebook
